item.title: Report E-2025010241
item.description:
Report E-2025010241

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-16
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 16, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 was punctured and released approximately 5-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized neutralizing agent and absorbents to remediate the site. The damaged drum was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack and all other waste was collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025010669

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Operation Supervisor states that they opened up trailer 572882 in dock door 60 when they found one whole bag of UN1823, SODIUM HYDROXIDE,SOLID, 8, PGII had spilled 40LB onto the trailer floor from what looks like a forklift puncture from the origin location.

item.title: Report E-2025010240
item.description:
Report E-2025010240

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: PARMA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO EXPRESS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, this tote was discovered leaking inside the trailer. The tote was immediately turned on it's side to prevent further release. After investigation, it was determined that this tote was damaged due to a load shift during transit. An empty tote was used as dunnage to protect the tote and a piece of wood on the skid broke and was pushed into the tote, causing puncture. The material was a thick liquid and was contained to the trailer floor. The material was absorbed using absorbent material and placed into an overpack container for later disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010224
item.description:
Report E-2025010224

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio Express
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: As the material was being loaded into a trailer at the destination terminal, a piece of protruding metal from another skid was accidentally pushed into the tote causing damage. The released material was contained to the trailer using neutralizer and absorbent material. The neutralizer and absorbent material was placed into an overpack for proper disposal. The IBC container was also turned on it's side as soon as possible to prevent further release of material.

item.title: Report E-2025010202
item.description:
Report E-2025010202

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When the warehouseman can in for work he went out to inspect the Wearhouse and found a poly drum on a pallet with material on the floor under the skid. He then put down some absorbent and called our emergency response. A team was dispatched to the facility and arrived at 0900 et. They determined that the crew did not have the proper PPE to handle the material. The material was contained and not actively leaking. There was not a crew available with the proper PPE until the next morning and they showed up at 0600et and began cleaning up the material and placing the drum into a salvage drum. the material was cleaned up with absorbent material and placed into the proper shipping container to be disposed of. The clean up was completed by 0830et.

item.title: Report E-2025010216
item.description:
Report E-2025010216

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-23
  • City: UHRICHSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 07:08 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XUR. It was reported that approximately 0.5 gallons of Natural Oak Basecoat/Primer released from one 5-gallon metal drum due to currently unknown reasons. The release impacted trailer #3152586. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Chemtrec has been notified, report number 2024122300019 was given by Alex. Waste label 223801-1 was created, one 30 gallon metal drum containing cardboard, 5-gallon metal drum with leftover product and protective gloves.

item.title: Report E-2025010163
item.description:
Report E-2025010163

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-13
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 13, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of methanol was damaged and released approximately 40-gallons to the trailer floor, asphalt beneath the trailer, and further migrated to a storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. The crew overpacked the drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. Absorbents and hand tools were used to remediate all impacted locations. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025010168
item.description:
Report E-2025010168

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately ten (10) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it and the damaged pails into two (2) 10-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010167
item.description:
Report E-2025010167

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately thirty (30) gallons of material released from six (6) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
